intro: Cynanchum krameri, commonly known as Krammer's milkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae, which includes many species of milkweeds. The plant is characterized by its slender stems, opposite leaves, and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It produces a milky sap that is typical of the genus Cynanchum. Cynanchum krameri is often found in dry, open habitats such as prairies and roadsides.
